timeline: Month 49-50 of the experiment, ~5 months after Chapter 27
location: Reed's apartment, strike locations across 17 sectors, Sector 15 strike headquarters

knows: 43,000 workers across 17 sectors are on strike
They're demanding structural changes, not UBI
The movement has transcended his funding
He has 5 months of funds remaining (4.2M credits)
Marcus is teaching organizing strategies to new generation
Corporate is scared and offering negotiations
Higher-level corporate wants to make him an offer
He's 36 years old now
The council wants to meet him in person
The revolution no longer needs him
Reed Salazar.emotional_state: Complex mix of grief, pride, relief, and hope. Feeling obsolete but also successful. Accepting mortality and irrelevance as signs of success.
Reed Salazar.physical_state: Still declining, shaking hands, Leveler dependent, exhausted, looking sick and thin

knows: The strikes are genuine grassroots organizing
Reed is struggling with becoming obsolete
The movement proves his experiment worked beyond money
Reed needs to come out of hiding and meet the movement
Workers learned solidarity from watching Sector 12
Dr. Amara Osei.emotional_state: Excited by the movement, protective of Reed, documenting historical moment

knows: Old union organizing strategies still work
Community can sustain through mutual aid
Solidarity is the key weapon
Sector 12 proved people deserve dignity
They don't need UBI to demand better treatment
Marcus Ibrahim.emotional_state: Empowered, teaching, finding renewed purpose in labor organizing
Marcus Ibrahim.physical_state: Managing pain better, energized by teaching and movement

knows: The strikes are unprecedented and widespread
Simple suppression won't work against 43,000 workers
Must negotiate or risk complete loss of control
Reed Salazar is still the key pressure point
Need to isolate Reed from the movement
Executive Director Jonathan Harris.emotional_state: Controlled panic, strategic retreat to negotiation

revealed_to_reader: Strike coordinated by Nova Prosperity Workers' Coordinating Council (new organization)
Workers demanding structural changes: living wages, healthcare, Board representation, end to prosperity score discrimination
Not demanding UBI - movement transcended original experiment
Corporate attempted threats, then shifted to negotiation offer
Reed has 4.2M credits left (5 months of funding)
Reed is 36 years old (had birthday last month)
Marcus teaching organizing strategies from old union days
Sectors organizing mutual aid networks to sustain strike
Corporate tried replacement workers, other sectors blocked them
Workers willing to tank prosperity scores for solidarity
Corporate higher-ups preparing 'final offer' for Reed
Reed agreed to meet coordinating council in person tomorrow
Reed sent simple 'No' to corporate offer

planted.element: Reed's agreement to meet council in person
planted.significance: Reed coming out of hiding sets up Amara finding him

planted.element: Workers' mutual aid networks sustaining strike
planted.payoff_chapter: Book 3 Ch 6 - Seeding Cooperatives, Ch 12 - UBI Ends
planted.significance: Community learning to sustain without UBI
Knowledge transfer before he's too old
Establishes his resistance to being bought
Core theme payoff - people sustain change

active_tensions: What will Reed meeting the council reveal?
What is the 'final offer' corporate is preparing?
What happens when UBI payments end?
world_changes: Nova Prosperity Workers' Coordinating Council exists - first multi-sector labor organization
Corporate forced to negotiate for first time
Mutual aid networks operating across sectors
Sector barriers breaking down through solidarity
Workers openly defying prosperity score consequences
Labor organizing back after decades of suppression
continuity_notes: Timeline: Month 49-50, approximately 5 months after Ch 27
Reed's funds: 4.2M credits (down from 7.8M in Ch 27)
Strike happened on Tuesday at 0900 hours
Workers' demands: 7 specific structural changes, no mention of UBI
Corporate gave 24-hour ultimatum, then shifted to negotiation
Mural on Building 4 repainted with 'We Are All Sector 12'
Reed hasn't slept in 3 days before this chapter
Amara embedded with Sector 15 strike coordination
Marcus teaching in Sector 15 strike headquarters

voice_check.Reed: Deadpan observations ('Revolutions should happen on Tuesdays'), complex emotions about obsolescence, dark humor, accepting
voice_check.Amara: Direct truth-telling, protective but pushing Reed to engage, documentary precision
voice_check.Marcus: Teaching voice, solidarity language, practical organizing wisdom
voice_check.Harris: Corporate negotiation-speak, euphemisms ('dialogue', 'good faith'), fear masked as disappointment

themes_advanced: Money as spark, people as sustaining fire
Solidarity as more powerful than individual benefits
Workers discovering own power through example
emotional_beats: Reed realizing he's obsolete - complex grief/pride
43,000 workers walking off - power of collective action
Marcus teaching in room full of workers - generational transfer
Corporate shifting from threats to negotiation - fear
Reed agreeing to meet council - choosing visibility
Mural showing cross-sector solidarity - movement unity
Dreaming of Marco seeing this - meaning in sacrifice
setup_for_next_chapters: Reed will meet coordinating council tomorrow
Amara will be there when Reed goes public
